text: In the present study , we found that tumor weight and volume were much smaller in the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice compared to the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice inoculated with B16 melanoma cells ( Figure 1A and 1B ) .

The tumor growth inhibition in the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice was associated with the inhibition of constitutively activated NF-kappaB and elevation of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the tumor tissue .

This anti-tumor activity was also associated with decreased expression of NF-kappaB target anti-apoptotic , cell proliferative , and tumor promoting genes ( Bcl-2 and <extra_id_0> C-IAP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) but with increased expression of their target apoptotic genes ; cleaved caspase-3 and 9 , and Bax ( Figure 3A-D ) .

In the tumor and the spleen , the number of cytotoxic CD8+ T cells , CD57+ natural killer cells , and the levels of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were increased ( Figure 4 and 5 ) .

These findings suggest that melanoma growth was inhibited in the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice , and that the elevation of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , accompanied with decreased NF-kappaB , is significant in the inhibition of melanoma growth in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice .
NF-kappaB regulates the expression of over 200 genes that control the immune system , cancer cell growth and inflammation [ 39 ] .

Because of its abilities to induce the expression of a large array of inflammatory mediators and its roles as core transcription factors in diverse immune responses , NF-kappaB has been recognized as a major factor responsible for cytokine - associated cancer development or anti-tumor immunity .

In the melanoma tumor tissues of the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice , the expression of NF-kappaB target cell death genes ( Bax , caspase-3 and 9 ) and the DNA binding activity of NF-kappaB , were significantly inhibited , but the expression of cell death inhibitory NF-kappaB target genes , such as Bcl-2 and cIAP were enhanced .

In addition , <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - prevented the phosphorylation of IkappaB , accompanied with the inhibition of the <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> translocation into the nucleus ( Figure 2A-C ) .
Many tumors , including melanoma , have increased levels of NF-kappaB [ 40 ] , which is likely acting as a survival factor for melanoma growth .
Thus , the inhibitions of NF-kappaB activity and the expression of target genes are critical in the inhibition of tumor growth in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice .

Although the mechanism is not clear as to how <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - downregulates NF-kappaB , it is noteworthy that NF-kappaB is activated or inactivated by many cytokines .
Numerous studies showed that cytokine affect tumor growth by regulating NF-kappaB .
Inflammatory cytokines , including IL-1 , <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and IL-8 , activate NF-kappaB pathways in tumor cells [ 41 ] .

The <extra_id_0> interleukin 10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is well known as an anti-tumor factor as well as an anti-inflammatory factor [ 42 ] , [ 43 ] .
<extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits constitutively activated NF-kappaB both in vitro [ 44 ] and in vivo [ 45 ] .

Inhibition of NF-kappaB by the <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> contributes to the anti-tumor effects through the activation of caspase-3 and apoptosis in Colon26-bearing mice [ 43 ] .
Similarly , several studies have demonstrated the ability of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to abrogate the proinflammatory effects of IL-1 [ 46 ] .
It has been reported that IL-1 induces the activation of NF-kappaB in several cancers , and increases cell cycle progression , and the suppression of apoptotic cell death leading to tumor promotion .

The results of various studies over the past 10 years indicate that the major function of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is to regulate the pleiotropic effects of IL-1 by competitively blocking its functions [ 47 ] .
The ability of IL-1 to induce its own antagonist is of interest in understanding the regulation and dysregulation of IL-1 signaling in normal and diseased tissue .
Up-regulation of the receptor antagonist represents a mechanism for turning off IL-1 signaling and creating a temporary state of refractoriness .

The elevated expression of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , without any change of IL-1 in tumors , suggests that the IL-1 - signaling system may be dysregulated by <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in tumors .
IL-1Ra has been shown to inhibit tumor progression in prostate , breast , and skin cancer [ 14 ] , [ 15 ] , [ 16 ] .

<extra_id_0> Intracellular IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> icIL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) inhibits <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and IL-8 production in Caco-2 cells by blocking NF-kappaB pathways [ 37 ] .

We found that the levels of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were significantly elevated in the tumor tissues of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice inoculated with B16 melanoma cells .

Taken together , these data indicate <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could be critically involved in the tumor growth inhibition of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice through the inactivation of NF-kappaB in the present study .

<extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> increases tumor growth in a local model and inhibits the efficacy of a dendrite cell vaccine in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice compared with <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice [ 10 ] .
Cheng J and Sung RS examined the effect of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on the immune response to adenovirus vectors and graft function in an islet transplant model .
They found that <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> absence does not prevent the local immune response to adenovirus transduction [ 48 ] .

Additionally , Tan MC et al . suggested that disruption of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CCL5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling , either by reducing <extra_id_0> CCL5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production by tumor cells or by systemic administration of a <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibitor ( TAK-779 ) , reduced Treg ( regulatory T cells ) migration to tumors so that tumors are smaller in control mice [ 9 ] .
These data support the important premise that inhibition of tumor growth in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice could be related with the inhibition of immune escape .

Similar to this finding , we found that the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice injected with melanoma cells apparently have a lower number of cytotoxic T cells ( CD8+positive T Lymphocytes cells ) and natural killer cells ( CD57 positive NK cells ) , as well as dendrite cells , in spleen tissues compared to those without melanoma cells .
But the lymphocytes of the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice did not decrease when injected with melanoma cells .

These differences of the immune response between the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice and the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice , involving tumor immune tolerance , may be connected with the inhibition of cancer progression .

Taken together , in the cytokine array experiment , the level of <extra_id_0> MIP-1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( which has a potent activity of T cell and B cell migration ) was increased in the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice compared with those in the <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice .
Thus , relatively increased tumor associated cytotoxic lymphocytes could play an important role in inhibiting the tumor growth in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice .
Activation of NF-kappaB could modulate subcellular localization of NK cells and pathogenesis [ 49 ] .
Inhibition of NF-kappaB activity prevented NK cell depletion , and thus increased anti-tumor activity by decreasing <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production [ 50 ] .

Thus , the decreased NF-kappaB and elevated <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could also be associated in the infiltration of cytotoxic lymphocytes into tumor , resulting in tumor growth inhibition .
In contrast , IL-23 , a tumor growth promoting cytokine , increased NF-kappaB and immune cell infiltration in oral tumor [ 51 ] .
These data indicate that NF-kappaB could be involved in the cytokine mediated anti-tumor activities of immune cells .
It is also noteworthy that <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibited melanoma tumor growth by increasing the number of myeloid suppressor cells in tumor [ 25 ] .

The 3-methylcholatrene - induced tumor incidence was reduced in <extra_id_0> IL-1alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> knockout mice , but increased in <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mice with concomitant maturation of NK cells and anti-tumor immunity [ 52 ] .

These data indicate that the decrease of NF-kappaB , and thus increase of <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could be significant in tumor growth inhibition of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice .

Our data thus show significant clinical implications of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , because <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a G protein - coupled receptor and it is amenable to use as a small molecule for the inhibition of <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Several such compounds have already been shown to be safe in clinical trials for use in certain diseases such as HIV [ 53 ] .
Thus , we believe <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a cancer target that warrants continued investigation .

In summary , this study showed that melanoma cells growth was inhibited via modulation of NF-kappaB / <extra_id_0> IL-1Ra <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> pathways in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice .
